name: Ashoka the Great
what_did:
Ashoka ruled a large empire in India.
After a big war, he became peaceful and followed Buddhism.
He built roads, schools, and hospitals, and spread messages of kindness and non-violence.
why_matters:
Ashoka showed that rulers could change and care deeply for their people.
He helped Buddhism grow across Asia.
His ideas about peace and good rule still inspire leaders today.

questions.q: What did Ashoka follow after the war?
What kind of messages did Ashoka spread?

fun_fact: Ashoka carved his messages on rocks and pillars so everyone could see them!
